notes: Christopher Heaney, Cradle of Gold: The Story of Hiram Bingham, a Real-life Indiana Jones, and the Search for Machu Picchu (New York: Palgrave Macmillan, 2011).
C. Frederick Westerberg Journal, April-November 1914, Folder 60, Box 23, Yale Peruvian Expedition Papers (YPEP), Yale University Manuscripts and Archives, New Haven, CT.
Edwin Anderson to Ellwood C. Erdis, Oct. 4, 1914, Folder 143, Box 11, YPEP.
Edwin Anderson to Ellwood C. Erdis, Oct. 4, 1914, Folder 143, Box 11, YPEP.

In surveying, the rear chainman held the back end of the long, thin steel surveying tape over the transit point, while the head chainman pulled the tape taught. It was heavy, hard work—“the worst,” according to some.
